name: Prazosin (Minipress)
summary: Prazosin is an alpha-1 adrenergic receptor antagonist primarily used to treat high blood pressure and, off-label, to reduce nightmares and improve sleep in post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
description: Prazosin, sold under the brand name Minipress, is an antihypertensive medication in the alpha-1 adrenergic blocker class. It works by relaxing blood vessels, making it easier for blood to flow and reducing blood pressure. Beyond hypertension, prazosin is often used off-label for PTSD-related nightmares and sleep disturbances. Its effectiveness in these cases is linked to its ability to reduce sympathetic nervous system activity during sleep. It is typically taken orally and requires titration to avoid side effects such as orthostatic hypotension.

contraindications: Known hypersensitivity to prazosin or other quinazolines

items: Management of PTSD-associated nightmares and sleep disruption (off-label)

sections.text: Prazosin selectively blocks alpha-1 adrenergic receptors on vascular smooth muscle, leading to vasodilation, reduced peripheral resistance, and decreased blood pressure. In PTSD, it is believed to reduce sympathetic outflow during sleep, decreasing the frequency and severity of nightmares.

adult.Hypertension: Initially 1 mg orally 2–3 times daily; maintenance typically 6–15 mg/day in divided doses
adult.PTSD nightmares: Start at 1 mg at bedtime; titrate up by 1 mg every few nights as tolerated (usual range 2–6 mg at bedtime)

pediatric.text: Not routinely recommended; limited data for PTSD-related sleep disturbances

sections.geriatric: Initiate at the lowest possible dose to minimize risk of hypotension

sections.text: Onset: 1–2 hours for antihypertensive effect; Duration: 6–10 hours

other: First-dose phenomenon with sudden and severe hypotension—initiate at bedtime
Use with caution in patients with existing hypotension or heart failure
May cause dizziness or fainting, especially when rising from a sitting or lying position

items: Blood pressure before and after starting therapy

sections.pregnancy: Category C; use only if potential benefit outweighs risk
sections.lactation: Unknown if excreted in breast milk; caution advised
sections.geriatrics: Greater sensitivity to hypotension; initiate at lower doses

sections.text: If discontinuing, reduce dose gradually to prevent rebound hypertension

items: Particularly useful in PTSD patients with severe nightmares and poor sleep quality
Start low and titrate slowly to reduce risk of orthostatic hypotension
Often combined with other antihypertensives in resistant hypertension
